newsitem.title: INDIA: India sees 9.0 bln rupees private rail investment.
newsitem.headline: India sees 9.0 bln rupees private rail investment.

text.p: India expects to raise nine billion rupees ($251.4 million) through private investment in its railways network in 1997/98 (April-March), against 5.3 billion in the current 1996/97, Railway Minister Ram Vilas Paswan said on Wednesday.
The private investment would be under the build-own-lease-transfer (BOLT) or the own-your-wagon (OYW) schemes, Paswan told parliament while presenting the railway budget for 1997/98.
The schemes were launched under India's economic reforms programme that started in 1991 to fund a cash-starved Indian railways.

The BOLT scheme involves building railway facilities that are ultimately transferred to the government. Under OYW, private firms buy wagons on which they carry their goods on state-run railway tracks. ($1 = 35.8 rupees)
